Dear Chief Schierbaum: 
 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (“ACRB”) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by 
 
 alleging that on February 12, 2022, Sergeant Dominique Pattillo (Unique 
ID No. 4043) engaged in excessive force when he placed her in a chokehold 
when he intervened to stop a physical altercation between her and an unidentified 
female that occurred in front of the Spinning Pie. 
 
 
 
The board determined the following: 
 
1. The allegation of Excessive Force be assigned a finding of “Not 
Sustained.” 
2. Sergeant Pattillo was in Violation of Atlanta Police Department’s 
(“APD”) Standard Operating Procedures (“SOPs”) for failing to 
notify his supervisor and complete a report detailing his actions 
stemming from this incident and assigned a finding of “Sustained” 
and recommends as penalty an Oral Admonishment.  
3. Sergeant Pattillo was in Violation of APD’s SOPs for working an 
extra job at the incident location, the Spinning Pie, without an 
approved Extra Job Permit on file and assigned a finding of 
“Sustained” and recommends, as penalty, a Written Reprimand.  
4. The allegation of Violation of APD’s SOPs for failing to have his 
body work camera activated at the time he intervened in the 
altercation between Ms. 
 and the other involved women and 
assigned a finding of “Sustained” and recommends, as a penalty, a 
three (3) day suspension.
